edu.biu.scapi.circuits.encryption

Class MultiSecretKey

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.circuits.encryption.MultiSecretKey
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MultiSecretKey
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is the Key to be used when encrypting with any @link MultiKeyEncryption} scheme.

    It generalizes the notion of a dual key cipher that is generally associated with Yao's protocol.

    A dual key cipher uses two keys and is thus only appropriate for encrypting 2-input GarbledGates.

    A MultiKey cipher can be used for any number of inputs. When it is used to encrypt a 2-input GarbledGate, it is a dual key cipher MultiKeyEncryptionScheme.

    It contains an array of SecretKeys that the MultiKeyEncryptionScheme will use to encrypt.

    Author:
    Steven Goldfeder
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiSecretKey

        public MultiSecretKey(javax.crypto.SecretKey... keys)
        A constructor that constructs a MultiSecretKey from any number of SecretKey objects.

        The SecretKeys can be passed to the constructor either in an array or as separate parameters.

        Parameters:
        keys - The SecretKeys that will be used to construct the MultiSecretKey. The SecretKeys can be passed to the constructor either in an array or as separate parameters.

    • Method Detail

        public javax.crypto.SecretKey[] getKeys()
        Returns an array of the SecretKeys from this MultiSecretKey.
        Returns:
        an array containing the individual SecretKey objects that make up this MultiSecretKey

      • getNumberOfKeys

        public int getNumberOfKeys()
